com.github.marcoshsc.orsApiTools.matrix

Class ORSMatrixRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.marcoshsc.orsApiTools.matrix.ORSMatrixRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Request<MatrixResponse>

    public class ORSMatrixRequest
extends java.lang.Object
implements Request<MatrixResponse>
    Make requests to the /matrix endpoint of the ORS API. There is support for any coordinate size, not like the ORS API itself that can't return a matrix with more than 3500 positions. User must set their parameters, headers and send the call makeRequest to get a response. A call to this method can last for several minutes depending on the locations size. https://openrouteservice.org/dev/#/api-docs/matrix/get for more information.
    Author:
    Marcos Henrique

      • handleMultipleCoordinates

        private MatrixResponse handleMultipleCoordinates()
                                          throws RequestException,
                                                 InvalidParameters,
                                                 org.json.JSONException,
                                                 java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Makes possible to handle more than 3500 positions in the final matrix. It looks at the location coordinates, if its size is lower than 60, make a single request and return the response. Otherwise, it will call a separated method, which will split the coordinates into smaller groups, make separated request, and group them all together at the end, returning a equivalent final response.
        Returns:
        final response referent to the parameters received.
        Throws:
        RequestException - if something goes wrong with the request.
        InvalidParameters - if something goes wrong with the parameters. See verifyErrors method.
        org.json.JSONException - if some JSON parsing error was encountered.
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if some character in the URL built could not be encoded.

      • isHandledBySingleRequest

        private boolean isHandledBySingleRequest()
        Return true if the request has enough size to be handled by one single request.
        Returns:
        condition evaluation.

      • handleWithSourceAndDestination

        private MatrixResponse handleWithSourceAndDestination()
                                               throws RequestException,
                                                      InvalidParameters,
                                                      org.json.JSONException,
                                                      java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Split the list of coordinates, makes the requests, concatenate them together and return the final response.
        Returns:
        the final matrix response
        Throws:
        RequestException - if something goes wrong with the request.
        InvalidParameters - if something goes wrong with the parameters. See verifyErrors method.
        org.json.JSONException - if some JSON parsing error was encountered.
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if some character in the URL built could not be encoded.

      • getResponseFromLoop

        private MatrixResponse getResponseFromLoop(java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.Coordinate> destinations,
                                           MatrixResponse finalResponse,
                                           int destinationFinalLength,
                                           java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.Coordinate> outerList)
                                    throws org.json.JSONException,
                                           InvalidParameters,
                                           java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                           RequestException
        Parameters:
        destinations - list of destinations
        finalResponse - the matrix response to be returned at the end.
        destinationFinalLength - division module of the size of destinations array by 59.
        outerList - list of source coordinates.
        Returns:
        final response.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if some JSON parsing error was encountered.
        InvalidParameters - if something goes wrong with the parameters. See verifyErrors method.
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if some character in the URL built could not be encoded.
        RequestException - if something goes wrong with the request.
